Emptiness itself cannot be obtained.
If a person has previously planted the seeds of wholesome roots,
Right in the place where nothing can be obtained,
They extinguish the mind, consciousness, and thought.
Only then do they understand what the Śākyamuni Tathāgata said.
Beginning from the Deer Park,
Ending at the Vālukera River,
In between these two places,
He never spoke a single word.
This is the truth.
Chan is not in a quiet place,
It is not in a noisy place,
It is not in the place of deliberation and discrimination,
It is not in the place of responding to conditions in daily activities.
However, it is like this.
